abilities.name: Form Variation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Basic Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Ditto) and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Place Ditto in the discard pile.

attacks.name: Energy Ball
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Ditto but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more then 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Link Needle
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage for each Beedrill (excluding this one) you have in play.

abilities.name: Sooth Dust
abilities.text: As long as Butterfree is your Active Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Dewgong by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psychic Exchange
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Draw up to 8 cards.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Basic Pokémon and each Evolution card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Fetch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: One-Two Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Power Gene
abilities.text: As long as Nidoking is in play, your attacks by Nidoran ♀, Nidorina, Nidoqueen, Nidoran ♂, and Nidorino do 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earth Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bound Crush
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Nidoking can't use Bound Crush during your next turn.

abilities.name: Family Bonds
abilities.text: As long as Nidoqueen is in play, the Retreat Cost for Nidoran ♀, Nidorina, Nidoran ♂, Nidorino and Nidoking is 0.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Power Lariat
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Evolved Pokémon you have in play.

abilities.name: Quick Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose any 1 card from your deck and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Quick Search Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Pidgeot is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Spiral
abilities.text: As long as Poliwrath is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Confused Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Mega Throw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to Raichu. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder Reflection
attacks.text: You may move any number of Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu to another of your Pokémon.

abilities.name: Strange Behavior
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to Slowbro as long as you don't Knock Out Slowbro. This power can't be used if Slowbro is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Rest Up
abilities.text: If Snorlax remains Asleep between turns, remove 2 damage counters from Snorlax (remove 1 if there is only 1).

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: Snorlax is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Toss and Turn
attacks.text: If Snorlax is Asleep, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. (This attack can be used even if Snorlax is Asleep.)

abilities.name: Fiery Aura
abilities.text: As long as Rapidash is your Active Pokémon, put 4 damage counters instead of 2 on Burned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Acid Sampler
abilities.text: As long as Victreebel is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Defending Pokémon between turns. Acid Sampler stops working if your other Active Pokémon is not a Victreebel.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: Arcanine does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. After doing damage, flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Egg Surprise
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, Chansey does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, remove 5 damage counters from Chansey. (All if there are less than 5.)

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Cloyster by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Bubble
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. If either of the coins is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is on your Bench, you pay ColorlessColorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Baby Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.text: If Fearow has no Energy attached to it, Fearow's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Shot Air
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hoard
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon that already have a Pokémon Tool attached to them). Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Eerie Aura
abilities.text: As long as Hypno is your Active Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on each Pokémon that remains Asleep between turns.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Salt Water
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Water Energy cards and attach them to Kingler. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hyper Pump
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy attached to Kingler but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Leaf Ride
abilities.text: If Scyther has any Energy attached to it, Scyther's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Toss
attacks.text: You may discard from your hand as many Technical Machine and Pokémon Tool cards as you like. This attack does 30 damage times the number of cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Speed Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vine Tease
attacks.text: Look at your Prize cards without showing your opponent. Choose 1 of the Prize cards and switch it with the top card of your deck without looking at the top card of your deck. If you have no cards in your deck, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Wiggle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Damage Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If Kakuna is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Kakuna is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: Head Trip
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Haunter is on your Bench, you may use this power. One of your Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Poison Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

abilities.name: Energy Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Metapod by attacks is reduced by 10 for each Energy attached to Metapod. You can't reduce more than 30 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Evolution cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Powder
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Toxic Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tunneling
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Onix can't attack during your next turn.

abilities.text: Persian can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: If you have less than 4 cards in your hand, draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, except damage, done to Venomoth by the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Thick Skin
abilities.text: Raticate can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Pickup
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Basic Pokémon (or Evolution card), a Trainer card, and an Energy card. Show them to your opponent and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

abilities.name: Assistance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Wigglytuff is on your Bench, you may choose 1 of your Active Pokémon and remove 1 Special Condition from it.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Wigglytuff by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Wartortle but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Wartortle with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metapod and a Butterfree card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.text: Switch Doduo with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Slow Trip Gas
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Magikarp and put it on Magikarp. (This counts as evolving Magikarp.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Krabby (remove 1 if there is only 1).

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Look for Friends
attacks.text: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Basic Pokémon. Show that card to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards into your deck. (If you don't reveal a Basic Pokémon, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)

attacks.text: Search your deck for a Nidoran ♀ or Nidoran ♂ card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.text: Both Slowpoke and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Floating Electrons
abilities.text: As long as Voltorb has any Energy attached to it, Voltorb's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Thundershock

attacks.name: Call for Family

data.name: Bill's Maintenance
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
If you have any cards in your hand, shuffle 1 of them into your deck, then draw 3 cards.

data.name: Celio's Network
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Energy Removal 2
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

data.name: EXP.ALL
rules: Attach EXP. ALL to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has an owner in its name) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

During your opponent's turn, if 1 of your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by your opponent's attack, you may take 1 basic Energy card attached to that Knocked Out Pokémon and attach it to the Pokémon with EXP.ALL attached to it. If you do, discard EXP.ALL.

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Life Herb
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), and remove all Special Conditions and 6 damage counters from that Pokémon (all if there are less than 6).

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Mt. Moon
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Any Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) with maximum HP less than 70 can't use any Poké-Powers.

data.name: PokéDex HANDY909
rules: Shuffle your deck. Look at 6 cards from the top of your deck, then put them back on top of your deck in any order.

data.name: Pokémon Reversal
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

data.name: Prof. Oak's Research
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

data.name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.name: VS Seeker
rules: Search your discard pile for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

data.name: Potion
rules: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 damage counter if that Pokémon has only 1).

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Charizard ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Energy Flame
abilities.text: All Energy attached to Charizard ex are Fire Energy instead of its usual type.

attacks.name: Burn Down
attacks.text: Discard 5 Fire Energy attached to Charizard ex. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, and any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Multi Energy
rules: Attach Multi Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Multi Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) Multi Energy provides Colorless Energy when attached to a Pokémon that already has Special Energy cards attached to it.

data.name: Blastoise ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Energy Rain
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blastoise ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hyper Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, your opponent discards an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Clefable ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Clefable ex's type is still Colorless.) Clefable ex performs that attack.

data.name: Electrode ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Extra Energy Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard Electrode ex and all the cards attached to it (this counts as Knocking Out Electrode ex). If you do, search your discard pile for 5 Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) in any way you like. This power can't be used if Electrode ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Crush and Burn
attacks.text: You may discard as many Energy as you like attached to your Pokémon in play. If you do, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy you discarded.

data.name: Gengar ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Trainer card in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Gyarados ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose 1 Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any, and discard it. If both are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Mr. Mime ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Magic Odds
abilities.text: If Mr. Mime ex would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Mr. Mime ex if that damage is 10, 30, 50, 70, 90, 110, 130, 150, or 170.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your opponent's hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Venusaur ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), move a Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Venusaur ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Pollen Hazard
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned, Burned, and Confused.

data.name: Articuno ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Articuno ex from your hand onto your Bench, you may switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with Articuno ex. If you do, you may also move any number of basic Water Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to Articuno ex.

attacks.name: Cold Crush
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Articuno ex. If you do, your opponent discards an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Charmander.

data.name: Mr. Mime ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Magic Evens
abilities.text: If Mr. Mime ex would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Mr. Mime ex if that damage is 20, 40, 60, 80, 100, 120, 140, 160, or 180.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your opponent's hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Moltres ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Moltres ex from your hand onto your Bench, you may switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with Moltres ex. If you do, you may also move any number of basic Fire Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to Moltres ex.

attacks.name: Crushing Flames
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Moltres ex. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Zapdos ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Zapdos ex from your hand onto your Bench, you may switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with Zapdos ex. If you do, you may also move any number of basic Lightning Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to Zapdos ex.

attacks.name: Electron Crush
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Zapdos ex. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.
